===JQuery UI Selectable as Wicket behavior example===

*[http://jqueryui.com/demos/selectable/ Original javascript version can be found here]*

*Prerequisites:* Your wicket application is configured to use JQWicket as described in the [http://code.google.com/p/jqwicket "Quick Start"] guide. Additionaly to the jquery core library you have to add "jquery ui" to the JQWicket's config.

*Description:* This example demonstrates how to integrate JQuery UI Selectable with wicket components using JQWicket.


*Java-Code:*
{{{
public class SelectablePage extends WebPage {
	public SelectablePage() {
		add(new WebMarkupContainer("selectable").add(JQBehaviors.selectable()));
	}
}
}}}

*Html-Template:*
{{{
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
	"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"
	xmlns:wicket="http://wicket.apache.org/" xml:lang="en" lang="en">
<head>
<title>Selectable example</title>
<style type="text/css">
li.ui-selecting {
	background: #FECA40;
}
li.ui-selected {
	background: #F39814;
	color: white;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>
<div class="demo">
<ol wicket:id="selectable">
	<li class="ui-widget-content">Item 1</li>
	<li class="ui-widget-content">Item 2</li>
	<li class="ui-widget-content">Item 3</li>
	<li class="ui-widget-content">Item 4</li>
	<li class="ui-widget-content">Item 5</li>
	<li class="ui-widget-content">Item 6</li>
	<li class="ui-widget-content">Item 7</li>
</ol>
</div>
</body>
</html>
}}}

*Rendered Html:*
{{{

*Note:* Instead of `JQBehaviors.selectable()` you can add an instance of `SelectableBehavior` to the component.

You can also configure selectable behavior by passing appropriate options object to it:

{{{
final Label selectable = new Label("selectable", "selectable label");
SelectableOptions options = new SelectableOptions()
            .selectingEvent(JQuery.$f("alert(event)", "event", "ui"));
selectable.add(new SelectableBehavior(options));
add(selectable);
}}}
